intro: Humiria montana, commonly known as the mountain humira, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features striking purple to pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Humiria montana thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
